page.title: 15ECOLOGY IN THE BALFRON AREA
page.content: The large areas of mixed woodlands in the Balfron district, the many streams flowing into the River Endrick, the roadside verges, the hedge-rows and "dry-stane dykes" all provide a wide variety of{habitats}for the many plants and animals found in the Balfron area. {Roedeer, badgers}and{foxes}are all present in the area,as are the smaller mammals like hares,squirrels,hedgehogs and rabbits. The{rabbit}population has increased again in the area recently. Salmon have been scarce in the Endrick over the last few years and poaching,on an organised basis, is on the increase,according to the{Water {Baillifs,}employed to manage the river by Loch Lomond Angling Association. Kingfishers are often seen by the Endrick and summer visitors, like the oyster-catcher and curlew,can be heard
